snippet: The company said it would expand its engine plant in the northern state of Chihuahua to build a new gasoline engine that will be exported to the United States, Canada, South America and the Asia-Pacific region.
abstract: Ford Motor says it plans to use $2.5 billion to create new generation of fuel-efficient engines and transmissions in Mexico, which will result in 3,800 new jobs.
lead_paragraph: The company said it would expand its engine plant in the northern state of Chihuahua to build a new gasoline engine that will be exported to the United States, Canada, South America and the Asia-Pacific region.

headline.main: Ford to Spend $2.5. Billion to Expand in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Ford to Spend $2.5 Billion to Expand in Mexico
